channel.title: Physics-T on Lightly Caffeinated
channel.description: Recent content in Physics-T on Lightly Caffeinated

item.title: Some phenomenology of anomalies
item.description: I’ve recently gotten interested in anomalies for a variety of reasons and more specifically anomaly inflow, mostly due to an offshoot of a current project.

item.title: Doing actual string theory in AdS/CFT
item.description: Not a lot of string theory in AdS/CFT # In the most well understood version of AdS/CFT, we stack N D3-branes and then see that the near horizon geometry is \(AdS_5 \times S^5\).

item.title: Dead Ends, Flat Holography, and 7d SCFTs
item.description: Every now and then, one pursues an idea thinking it could lead to something interesting, but then soon finds a dead end.

item.title: On Complexity in QFT and Algebras
item.description: Operators and Black Hole Info # Today, the arxivs have graced us with a paper on An Operator Algebraic Approach To Black Hole Information by van der Heijden and Verlinde.

item.title: On Holography for Laymen
item.description: Edit 29 Sep 2024: At some point I’d like to revisit this.
